metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the win-def:metabase_test probe is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the win-def:metabase_test probe.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

criterion.comment: Test that an metabase_object with a key and id is supported.
Test that an metabase_object with a key using pattern match and a id using equals is supported.
Test that an metabase_object with a key using not equals and a id using equals is supported.

metabase_test.comment: Test that an metabase_object with a key and id is supported.
Test that an metabase_object with a key using pattern match and a id using equals is supported.
Test that an metabase_object with a key using not equals and a id using equals is supported.

metabase_object.comment: This object represents a metabase_object with a key equal to '/' and a id equal to '1002'.
This object represents a metabase_object with a key that matches the regular expression '.*' and a id that equals '1002'.
This object represents a metabase_object with a key that is not equal to '/' and a id that equals '1002'.

metabase_state.comment: This state represents an metabase_object with a key equal to '/', a id equal to '1002', user_type, data_type, and data that match the regular expression '.*'.
This state represents an metabase_object with a key that matches the regular expression '.*', a id equal to '1002', user_type, data_type, and data that match the regular expression '.*'.
This state represents an metabase_object with a key not equal to '/', a id equal to '1002', user_type, data_type, and data that match the regular expression '.*'.
